content.text: Fetching latest Go release, searching for Python version strings, then applying changes.

payload.name: shell
payload.arguments:
{"command":["bash","-lc","set -e
# Latest Go version
LATEST=$(curl -s https://go.dev/VERSION?m=text | head -n1)
echo "LATEST_GO=$LATEST"

echo '---'
# Broader search for python version strings
rg -n --hidden -S "python ?(3\.[0-9]+|[0-9]+\.[0-9]+)" || true

echo '---'
rg -n --hidden -S "Python[^
]{0,40}3\.[0-9]+" || true
"]}

payload.message:
Hereâ€™s what I changed and what I found.

Changes made
- Updated Go version: `go.mod:3` â†’ `go 1.24`
- Ensured Python version: `.python-version:1` â†’ `3.10` (already 3.10)
- Added version notes to:
  - `README.zh-TW.md:167`ï¼ˆæ–°å¢ã€Œç‰ˆæœ¬éœ€æ±‚èªªæ˜ã€æ®µè½ï¼‰
  - `README.zh-CN.md:167`ï¼ˆæ–°å¢ã€Œç‰ˆæœ¬è¦æ±‚è¯´æ˜ã€æ®µè½ï¼‰
- Deleted: `TODO.md`

Findings
- Why go.mod showed 1.24: It was written based on the Go toolchain in use when the module was initialized or later updated (e.g., during `go mod init` or a subsequent `go mod tidy`/`go get` on Go 1.24). Weâ€™ve unified it to `1.24` (no patch).
- Support â€œ1.24 ä»¥ä¸Šå°±èƒ½ä½¿ç”¨â€: In Go, the `go` directive sets the language version baseline. Using Go 1.24 or newer compilers is supported; older compilers may fail to build.
- Hardcoded Python versions elsewhere:
  - `cmd/claude-code-helper/example.py:2` â€” `# requires-python = ">=3.12"` (comment, example only)
  - `examples/claude_code_log.json:20`/`:27` â€” example text mentions `>=3.12` (documentation content, not config)
  - No active config files pin Python besides `.python-version`.

Answers
- Is the Go version decided at `go mod init`? Yes. `go mod init` seeds the `go` directive from the current toolchain. Later `go mod tidy`/`go get` can raise it; you can also edit it manually (as done here).
- Latest Go version (online): `go1.25.1` (from https://go.dev/VERSION?m=text).

What to know
- Minimum Go now: 1.24 (1.24+ compilers work).
- Python runtime for dev: 3.10 via `.python-version`. The only other Python version mentions are examples/comments; no changes needed unless you want those docs updated too.

Files touched
- go.mod:3
- .python-version:1
- README.zh-TW.md:167
- README.zh-CN.md:167
- Deleted: TODO.md

Want me to also scrub or reword the example files that mention Python 3.12 to avoid confusion?
